cubrid_fetch_row -- Returns a numerical array with the values of the current
row

  array cubrid_fetch_row(resource result)~

This function returns a numerical array with the values of the current row
from the result set, starting from 0.

{result} {result} comes from a call to |cubrid_execute|

A numerical array, when process is successful.

FALSE on failure.

|cubrid_fetch_row| example

<?php >
      $link = cubrid_connect("localhost", 30000, "demodb2", "dba", "");
      if (!$link)
      {
          die('Could not connect.');
      }
      $query = 'SELECT name, address, salary FROM employees';
      $result = cubrid_execute($link, $query);
      if ($result) 
      {
          $row = cubrid_fetch_row($result);
          echo $row[0]."<BR>".$row[1]."<BR>".$row[2]."<BR>";
  
          cubrid_close_request($result); 
      }
?>

The above example will output:

  Result:
  Peter
  1st Avenue, New York
  1000.0000000000000000

vim:ft=help:
